author: draganrakita
content: for eip-3074 why dont we include authorized msg inside transaction. This would allow checking and bumping both authorized and sender nonces from just looking at tx?

author: lightclient
content: there is no "authorized" nonce though? it's just the account nonce?

author: draganrakita
content: There is nonce over msg that gets signed: `keccak256(MAGIC || chainId || nonce || invokerAddress || commit)` https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-3074.md#behavior

author: lightclient
content: yeah that is the EOA's nonce

author: lightclient
content: this allows the user to "revoke" outstanding AUTHs by sending a tx (bumping the nonce)

author: draganrakita
content: if that msg with additional sig is included in tx, than it can be checked easily and bumped when that tx gets executed

author: draganrakita
content: bumping two nonces one for caller second from authorization account

author: lightclient
content: do you mean bumped in the account state or bumped in the tx (to avoid becoming invalid) ?

author: lightclient
content: I don't really follow, sorry

author: draganrakita
content: bumping in account (to make authorization msg more precise)

author: lightclient
content: AUTH/AUTHCALL do not bump the accounts nonce at all, this is partially by design because if the AUTH message is relayed to the chain it can be reused many times

author: lightclient
content: which allows EOAs to delegate to a different hot key with stricter access controls
